About this item

  • Double Layer UV Blocking System - Intense UV protection provided by SPA 45+ PA+++ Sunscreen and protection from black spots, fine dust, and poor skin tones that strong sun rays can bring on
  • Persistent Sun Protection - Advanced double-layer polymer system helps shield your skin from UVA and UVB rays by remaining in place longer through sweat, water, and heat
  • Nourishing 6-Essence Complex - A botanical blend of pure plant extracts hydrates and moisturizes the skin to help reveal a softer, smoother, fairer complexion
  • Hypoallergenic - Purescreen Technology is used in this product, which has a hypoallergenic solution that is soft on skin and absorbs, reflects, and scatters harmful UV rays
  • Lightweight Texture - Sunscreen is quickly absorbed into the skin without leaving a greasy feeling or a white cast

How customer reviews and ratings work

Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we dont use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness.

2.0 out of 5 stars Its still not 70 ml. 50 ml as of Feb, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
1) the packaging has changed again. Its not green, its now pink. Its still not the advertised 70 ml, and its no longer rated as 50+ spf, but 45.As a facial sunscreen, I hope it continues to work as well as it has over the last few years, but the packaging/listing errors are a problem. Missha really should update this, or at least sell what they advertise on their website instead of this weird other thing that nobody else seems to carry.It does still dry down/absorb with a soft, almost powdery texture instead of the shiny, plastic-y texture of most sunscreens, and it still doesnt irritate my eyes if I use my eye socket bones as a boundary, which is why I do keep buying it. There arent many sunscreens that work and dont make my eyes burn all day.It goes on the skin after cleansing, let it dry (2 minutes of teeth brushing is about right), then apply moisturizer and let that absorb, then primer and/or foundation.

Sydney C.
3.0 out of 5 stars Box tampered with and different smell?
Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021
Verified Purchase
I have purchased this exact product two times without issue, plus the most recent purchase this week. Of course I bought it again due to really liking it! But, it seems like there were way too many issues that were overlooked or not advertised to the customer this time around (especially considering the price has gone up by at least $3-4 from when I first started buying this, which is a pretty decent % increase for a lower quality product).

*The price increasing over the last few years is understandable, but I expect to get the product I ordered that much more.

1) The packaging was a MESS. It was clear that tape had been thrown on the box but whoever did that, completely missed actually closing the package, totally defeating the point, and delivering an essentially open box to me. The tape covered a random side of the box but did not go over any of the creased nor was it put on with enough care to actually keep the box closed. I'm not sure how either a robot or person could literally miss the closure.

2) Although it says nothing about the formula has changed, and the bottle looks identical in fact, the smell is very different from the last two, which was (in addition to the texture and protection) a huge plus for me as i am sensitive to perfume/ flowery smells. The last two did have a scent, but very mild and pleasant, and generally died down shortly after putting it on. It was not a specific scent or the typical sunscreen scent, but again just a mild, doable scent. This time around, it smells like pure flowery perfume. I still have some of my previous bottle, so I went to smell both of them to be sure I wasn't just overthinking, and the scent most definitely changed. That used to be one of the biggest pluses, but now it's one of the biggest downfalls of this product, which is a huge bummer as I really like it otherwise.

If the formula/ scent had been changed even in the slightest of ways, that should have been advertised, especially as a repeat customer who thought I knew exactly what I was getting. If the formula was not changed (supposedly), then that's even more questionable...it is very clearly a much stronger and different scent that I could see many people not wanting on their faces unless you are specifically looking for sunscreen that smells more perfume-like.

Constance S. Edwards
2.0 out of 5 stars Its still not 70 ml. 50 ml as of Feb, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
Verified Purchase
1) the packaging has changed again. Its not green, its now pink. Its still not the advertised 70 ml, and its no longer rated as 50+ spf, but 45.

As a facial sunscreen, I hope it continues to work as well as it has over the last few years, but the packaging/listing errors are a problem. Missha really should update this, or at least sell what they advertise on their website instead of this weird other thing that nobody else seems to carry.

It does still dry down/absorb with a soft, almost powdery texture instead of the shiny, plastic-y texture of most sunscreens, and it still doesnt irritate my eyes if I use my eye socket bones as a boundary, which is why I do keep buying it. There arent many sunscreens that work and dont make my eyes burn all day.

It goes on the skin after cleansing, let it dry (2 minutes of teeth brushing is about right), then apply moisturizer and let that absorb, then primer and/or foundation.
